item.title: HTML limits you to a signed 32-bit int in ordered lists
item.description: HTML allows you to specify a starting number from which an ordered list (<ol>) should start. I thought “Is there an upper bound?”. Turns out: Yes, there is. It’s 2147483647 (i.e. 231-1). Looks like a signed 32-bit integer to me. <ol start=2147483645> <li>I am still in order</li> <li>As am I</li> <li>Me too</li> <li>Limit reached</li> <li>Limit reached</li> <li>Limit reached</li> </ol> The above snippet will render as the following:
